file_content.text: Stay back! The door is locked and sealed! You can't get in!
We heard all of the fighting, and we heard you talking to that freak Krel! We're not coming out until you swear you won't hurt us!
I'm sorry, but I can't just let you go.
You're too dangerous.
Just open the door, let's talk about this.
We'll work this out.
My orders are to kill you, and that's what I'm going to do.
Let's get this over with.
But we're not cyborgs! I'd know if I was some half-machine freak! This is insane!
You out there! Listen--I'm not sure about these others, but I can assure you that I'm not a cyborg!
What? Are you calling me a freak like Krel? I'm not a freak! Maybe you're the cyborg, and you're trying to trick everyone!
I am not! He spent far more time operating on you than he did on me, so if anyone is--
Both of you, stop it! None of us are cyborgs! That's all there is to it!
There's just no way to tell for sure, ma'am.
We don't know that.
Prove you aren't cyborgs, and I'll let you go.
I need proof.
What do you mean, "prove we aren't cyborgs"? You might as well ask us to prove we're not rancors! It's obvious, isn't it?
You're lying.
This is insane! Even if a few of us are cyborgs, would you really murder all of us just to be sure none of the cyborgs escape?
I'm sorry, ma'am, but there's no other choice.
I'm just following orders.
You're right--this is absurd. I can't do this.
No, I won't kill you.
Then, you won't hurt us? You'll let us go?
You're free to go--all of you.
Yes.
Orders are orders.
Nope. [Drain air from lab]
I'm getting tired of arguing about this through a door.
Open the door--now.
Please, soldier--think this through. Cyborgs or not, we haven't done anything wrong. There's no reason to kill us.
I can't kill innocent people. Come on out, I won't hurt you.
You're right--you can go.
Give me your names and identification numbers, and I'll let you go.
You can go if you give me ID.
What? So you can track us all down and kill us later? No way!
If it gets us out of here alive, then it's worth it. We'll put the information on a datapad for you, soldier.
Okay, stand back--I'm going to open the door.
Here's the datapad, soldier. Thank you for sparing us. Let's go home, everyone!
Come on out, everyone. It's going to feel so good to go home....
Stay safe out there.
Goodbye.
I'd better not find out you were dangerous after all.
Don't make me regret this.
We won't harm anyone, I swear it.
Thanks again, soldier. Farewell.
Sorry--this was the only way.
Home? Not likely. [Kill them]
What? Oh no, no!
My orders are reason enough.
Too bad. [Drain air from lab]
What? What are you....
